text: Casanate, is a village in Álamos Municipality in the Mexican state of Sonora, in northwestern Mexico. It is 48.5 kilometers south southeast of Álamos and 26.7 kilometers Northwest of El Fuerte, in Sinaloa. It lies on the left bank of the Rio Cuchujaqui at an elevation of 140 meters. Its population at the time of its last census was 69 persons, 37 males and 32 females.CASANATE from mexico.pueblosamerica.com accessed February 8, 2019. == History == Casanate, was the location of a hacienda of Rancho Tapizuelas built by the Spanish Colonel of Militias, of Real de Los Alamos, Don Francisco Julian De Alvarado after he acquired the rancho on July 1, 1748. It was one of the stops located along the route of El Camino Real through Sinaloa and Sonora between El Fuerte, Sinaloa and Álamos, Sonora. Álamos a través de los siglos; May 10, 2019; COMUNIDADES DE ÁLAMOS: TAPIZUELAS from facebook.com/alamosatravesdelossiglos/posts/ accessed November 12, 2019 == References == Category:Populated places in Sonora Category:Populated places established in the 18th century
title: Casanate, Álamos Municipality, Sonora
